column2: You will hear somebody talking about which of two things they prefer. Listen and complete the sentences. Use the structure prefer (one thing) to (another).
column5:
A: Basketball or football?  Which do you prefer?
B: Basketball.

column2: You will hear somebody talking about which of two things they prefer. Listen and complete the sentences. Use the structure prefer (one thing) to (another).
column3: She prefers {{c1::going}} to the cinema {{c1::to}} watching movies at home.
column5:
A: Do you like going to the cinema or do you prefer watching movies at home?
B: Going to the cinema.  It's more fun!

column2: You will hear somebody talking about which of two things they prefer. Listen and complete the sentences. Use the structure prefer (one thing) to (another).
column3: He prefers being very busy {{c1::to having|rather than having}} nothing to do.
column5:
A: Which do you prefer?  Being very busy or having nothing to do?
B: Being very busy.  I don't like having nothing to do.

column2: You will hear somebody talking about which of two things they prefer. Listen and complete the sentences. Use the structure prefer (one thing) to (another).
column3: She prefers {{c1::working|to work}} with other people {{c1::to working|rather than working|rather than work|rather than}} on her own.
column5:
A: Do you like working on your own, or do you prefer working with other people?
B: Working with other people.  I really don't like working on my own.
